body.name: First Aid Splint 36" X 4.3" Orange-Gray (Folded) Ideal for Sports, Home, First Aid Refill and Pets…
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 10 hrs 11 mins
features: 【1. Superior Support】The Aid Mate Splint provides exceptional support with its robust construction. Crafted using a lightweight aluminum alloy core, it is enveloped between two layers of closed-cell foam, ensuring reliable support for pre- or post-cast care.

【2. Versatile & Adjustable】Our splint is designed for adaptability. It can be easily cut to fit any size requirement using regular scissors. Moreover, it is flexible enough to be reshaped for different injuries or conveniently stored away when not in use.

【3. Waterproof & Easy to Maintain】Featuring a closed-pore and impermeable foam surface, the Aid Mate Splint is completely waterproof, making it effortless to clean and disinfect. Additionally, it is radiolucent, enabling X-rays to be conducted without removing the splint.

【4. Lightweight & Portable】Compactness is key when it comes to emergency situations. With dimensions of 36" x 4.3" and weighing a mere 160g, our splint can be easily rolled up and stored in emergency kits, medical bags, or tactical pouches, ensuring swift access when needed.

【5. Trusted by Professionals】The Aid Mate splint is the go-to choice for a wide range of professionals worldwide. Trusted by EMS personnel, military medics, athletic trainers, ski patrols, wilderness rescue teams, outdoor adventurers, boaters, safety engineers, and veterinarians, our splint is a testament to its professional-grade quality and reliability.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for camping, hiking, easy quick bone splits

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Has everything you need!
reviews.reviewText: Excellent to have at home and in the car. Contains all the essential items needed if an emergency occurs. Now all I need is an AED!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for the first aid kit.
reviews.reviewText: My son is a mountain biker and suffers many injuries. As a result, I try to have as many first aid type things as I can on hand. This is a complete set with all you need to treat up to four different injuries. Tape and splints are included to make this all you need for these minor injuries or to get you to the next medical help. for those who have active kids this is a must have for the first aid box. Im happy with my choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stocking up for my emergency medical kit
reviews.reviewText: Wanted them for an emergency situation and they will due nicely in a medical problem, i.e. broken bones, sprains or stabilizing an injury.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the cost.
reviews.reviewText: These run about 1/2 the coast of the SAM splints, which I own, but I can’t find any different in construction or materials. I suspect the SAM brand has added cost due to testing and maybe a certification process i.e. FDA/DOD?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good addition to medical supplies, surprisingly good compared to name brand.
reviews.reviewText: Compared to the more known SAM splints, these actually hold up very well it seems and while they are not the cheapest option, they definitely seem to be well made. I like the different sizes, although for most people I always recommend the biggest as the most important, since you can cut them to size if needed but it's hard to make one bigger. The included bag is great, although the bandage tape/Koban/krolex/vet wrap, whatever you call it, is definitely on the cheaper side.These are a great addition when further away from help, but I cannot stress practice enough. These aren't as simple to use (properly) as you might think. I believe they will hold up well and even the name brand ones aren't going to return to their original state perfectly. I have some taped up to cover sharp edges and wrinkled like paper, but they still work. These will likely last just as long.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice splint set
reviews.reviewText: I saw these and decided to get them to donate to my son's Boy Scout troop. It's one of those things that you hope to never need, but you'll be glad to have it if you do need it. Good product!
